summary: This is an email exchange between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a draft detention memo for Jeffrey Epstein's case. The sender finds the draft persuasive and believes there is a real shot at detention, requesting it be circulated to senior officials ("the Brass") for review.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email discussing the detention memo draft, likely a prosecutor working on the Epstein case in the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Draft Detention Memo Circulation
events.description: Prosecutors in the Southern District of New York discuss and circulate a draft detention memo for Jeffrey Epstein's case, expressing optimism about securing detention.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors were working on a detention memo for Jeffrey Epstein as of June 2020.
The email author expressed that the draft was 'persuasive' and that 'we might have a real shot at detention.'
The document indicates coordination among prosecution team members and plans to circulate the draft to senior officials ('the Brass').
The correspondence originated from the Southern District of New York's office at One Saint Andrew's Plaza.
The email discusses procedural steps for reviewing and finalizing the detention memorandum.
